snippet: Nearly two decades after Zhu Ling was poisoned, her case has electrified the nation with questions about the power of China’s political elite in a society where justice remains elusive.
abstract: Case of Zhu Ling, student at one of China’s top universities who was mysteriously poisoned in 1995, is ricocheting back into public consciousness, electrifying nation with questions about the power of the country's political elite in a society where justice remains elusive.

byline.contributor: Mia Li and Sue-Lin Wong contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Nearly two decades after Zhu Ling was poisoned, her case has electrified the nation with questions about the power of China’s political elite in a society where justice remains elusive.

headline.seo: Zhu Ling Case Re-emerges, Unleashing Chinese Fury
headline.main: Poison Attack Revives Fury in China Over ’95 Case
headline.print_headline: Poison Attack Revives Fury In China Over ’95 Case
